definition: lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: This article can make your open a book good below the hope.
sentences.chinese: 希望下面這篇文章能夠使你開卷有益。

sentences.english: Not until then did I understand reading benefits a lot.
sentences.chinese: 直到那時我才理解了開卷有益的含義。

sentences.english: To open a book is always beneficial. Reading can help us to accumulate our knowledge and enrich our life.
sentences.chinese: 開卷有益，讀書能讓我們增長知識，豐富課餘生活。

definition: to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
